questions.question: 1. Which of the following is a common application of ITC?
2. What is the primary advantage of ITC over other binding assays?
3. What information does the shape of the ITC curve provide?
4. What is the role of the reference cell in an ITC experiment?

answers.a: To measure the absolute temperature of the solution
answers.b: To calibrate the injection syringe for accurate volume delivery
answers.c: To provide a baseline for comparison with the heat changes in the sample cell
answers.d: To monitor changes in pressure during the titration process

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements regarding the interpretation of ITC data is correct?

answers.a: A positive enthalpy change (ΔH) always indicates an exothermic reaction
answers.b: The shape of the ITC curve is independent of the stoichiometry of the binding interaction
answers.c: The binding constant (Ka) can be accurately determined from a single ITC experiment
answers.d: An isothermal experiment can accurately measure changes in entropy (ΔS)

questions.question: 6. In an ITC experiment, what is the primary reason for injecting the titrant solution incrementally rather than all at once?

answers.d: To minimize heat loss to the surroundings

questions.question: 7. In an ITC experiment, what does the term 'stoichiometry' refer to?

answers.a: The ratio of titrant to sample volume in each injection
answers.b: The ratio of the concentrations of the interacting molecules
answers.c: The number of binding sites on the sample molecule
answers.d: The number of injections required to achieve binding saturation

questions.question: 8. Which of the following factors can affect the accuracy of the enthalpy change (ΔH) measured by ITC?

answers.b: Size of the syringe used for injections

questions.question: 9. Which of the following techniques is commonly used to validate the results obtained from an ITC experiment?
